alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 29 at 12:34PM CST until January 29 at 1:45PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central East Baton Rouge Parish in southeastern Louisiana... * Until 145 PM CST. * At 1234 PM CST, Radar shows thunderstorm intensity has decreased across the warned area, however rain is still occurring. Between 5 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding of roads and drainages is occurring and is expected to continue because water will be slow to drain from the flooded areas. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Baton Rouge, Denham Springs, Oak Hills Place, Westminster, Inniswold, Village St. George, Gardere, Shenandoah, Merrydale and Old Jefferson. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 155 and 168. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 9. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 5. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
